description: Everything working fine. Realme C55 Android 14.

After installing, I logged off/on my PC, then opened the gnome extensions and enabled it. I also had an issue with my firewall blocking the connection so a simple  
sudo firewall-cmd --permanent --zone=public --add-service=kdeconnect
sudo firewall-cmd --reload
 worked for me. Now I have to figure out how to get it to bypass the vpn on android (so if you have a VPN keep that in mind when trying to connect as well).
It works really well for transferring files between my phone and laptop, as well as using the phone as a remote keyboard/mouse. The media remote is nice, too.
No problem share files, messages etc.
Need to find a way so that the phone and PC can talk to each other even when the phone is on a mobile network (something the Myphone App does on Win10). This is very critical for a lot of users.
A must have gnome extension for me
Used it for a long time on fedora 33. Only had minor issues, but compared to its pros, the cons are just unsubstantial.
This thing just never works, period. It is a joke, an absolute joke. I'd give it half a star if I could.

You need
1. openssh installed
2. logout and log back in!

Messages can take a little to come across from phone. Be patient.

I'm using the beta version of KDE Connect on my ipad in combination with GSConnect on Fedora 35. After installing, I had to enable the extension with gnome-shell-extension-tool -e gsconnect@andyholmes.github.io . 
I can send and receive individual files, but not entire folders. That's probably an ipad thing. Otherwise I'm happy.
summary: Easy way to send files to and from ipad

description: It is very easy to use. Once installed all you have to do is to install it on your phone, connect to your PC and enjoy limitless file access, media transfer options, SMS, media control and much more.
I don't think there's another GNOME implementation of KDEConnect but this still works like a charm.

When I left Windows 10 for good I quickly missed the ease of sharing files and notifications through Microsoft's Your Phone application. KDE Connect and GS Connect create an experience that is very similar and better with the ability to mount your android phone's storage.
summary: Simular features as Windows' Your Phone app

description: I have it on my phone and both my laptops. It not only allows me to share files, notification and functions between phone and computer but also provides a really quick, simple way to transfer files from one laptop to the other... So much better than it's Windows equivalent!

I have recently tried to use this, but when installation is complete I can't see it in the Extension. so what's the problem can you help me solving it. It would be much appreciated if you could address it.
summary: Could you help me address this problem!

description: I was able to install and use mobile app and desktop version both. However, the only thing I could not find for the call management. No configuration found for picking phone from laptop device.

Like many apps, here's the issue:
There are NO instructions how to use the app at all.
It's a trial and error at best. I managed to transfer files between my android device and my ubuntu pc, but NO idea how to share screens in any direction. NO idea how to control a presentation from the android.
Lots of words on what and how great is the app, but nothing really useful for the user (unless you're an expert).
summary: May be a great APP ... But

description: I can't see the app after installation completed.
I was not able to send text messages with my Nokia XR20
This app / extension doesn't seem to work at all.

Installed this and gnome tweaks and a gnome extension manager. installed gsconnect through that extension manager. paired it to kdeconnect android app now complete functionality. Could of been easier if there was like a how two attatched to this store download for us mere ubuntu users.
In the web people are talking about downloading it from the extensions.gnome.org solves the problem.

I mainly use this when logging in to web sites that send an SMS text message for 2-factor authentication, so that I don't have to get my phone out. It does that job pretty well.

However, I had a bit of a fight persuading it to work on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS. As stated in the review by gee dated 15 March 2023, it requires several moving parts: GSConnect itself, Gnome Extension Manager (to enable the GSConnect shell extension), and KDE Connect on your Android phone. I'm not sure whether you still need Gnome Tweaks, to enable Gnome Shell Extensions in general; the Gnome Extension Manager seems to do that job now.

I found that the forwarding of inbound text messages to Linux only works if you have Firefox running. Presumably this particular function is handled by the browser and Firefox is the only browser that has the functionality built in. This confused me for a while as I am a migrant from Windows, where I used the Microsoft Edge browser and have a lot of Collections, so I had just installed Edge onto Ubuntu and synced up. I found a GSConnect browser extension in the Chrome Web Store which you can add to Edge as well, but I couldn't make it work - it gave me a "service unavailable" error. I ended up using Edge as my main browser but with an instance of Firefox running as well, just to make GSConnect work.

I found the following pages helpful, but a bit out of date:

https://www.omgubuntu.co.uk/2018/11/connect-android-ubuntu-gsconnect
https://www.jameskupke.com/posts/gsconnect-on-ubuntu/
https://askubuntu.com/questions/75530/how-do-i-install-and-manage-gnome-shell-extensions
summary: Good once you've figured out how to install it

description: It's a good thing that this is listed in the software store, however it should be noted here that you need to use Extension Manager to enable it, as other comments have pointed out.
summary: No information on how to enable it

description: It is very usefull for integrating your phone with the desktop.
No icons appear so app cannot be started or configured
summary: Does not work on Ubuntu 22.04.2 LTS

description: ive been using this on arch but at ubuntu i cant find its desktop icon
Easy to setup. Don't forget to add the extension.
Like many others I have the problem that I cannot find the proper way to start it. A little howto would really help!
summary: Unable to find a way to start it

description: Icon doesn't appear, cant open it from Software app.
right now i am using my phone to write this review from this app, its amazing
Does not complete install from Software installation and can not be installed from dnf because it can not be found by dnf.
Pairs with my iPhone but always fails to send photos from phone to computer
summary: Would probably be great... if it worked?

description: I like it, its save my time
https://extensions.gnome.org/extension/1319/gsconnect/
summary: You have to install the gnome extension part to make it work

description: ive tried installing several times and after installing cant find the app any where and the phone app cant see a system to conect to

Unfortunately it looks like this is not working, and there isn't anyone supporting it anymore. So, I recommend passing on this so that you don't have unnecessary software installed. Or someone can recreate it.
On Fedora 39 with an iPhoneXS.
summary: Works well if you have installed the extension as well

description:
Like other reviews i struggled to launch the app.
The trick is to enable it in the Gnome Extensions application. You then get a button next to your bluetooth, wifi etc in the top right drop down.
I'm connecting to KDE connect on my phone
summary: Enable in Extensions and it will work!

description: Eine wirklich vielseitige und einfache Software. Man mit ihr gut Daten zwischen seine Geräten austauschen. Manche features arbeiten jedoch nicht richtig bei mir wie der Laserpointer oder die Gerätesteuerung. Dies ist aber meiner Meinung nach zuvernachlässigen, da ich mir die Software nicht als Laserpointerersatz geholt habe.

Siempre había usado KDEConnect, pero ahora quise probar esta adaptación (GSConnect) ya que uso Gnome, pero no fué detectada por mi smartphone, y jamás pude verla en las aplicaciones. Antes lo había usado en derivados de Ubuntu y no había tenido problemas. Tendré que probar la versión "normal" (KDE Connect) haber si con eso.

Solía ser una herramienta tan buena, que resultaba atractiva para trabajar en Linux. Ahora, tras la última actualización dejó de funcionar. Tras desinstalar y volver a instalar ni siquiera reconoce dispositivos ni permite ser reconocida por otros.

Después de instalarlo no se encuentra por ningún lado la aplicación; no se detecta ni con el smartphone, y no la encuentro dentro de las aplicaciones instaladas. Qué mas tengo que hacer después de instalarlo?
summary: No se ve por ningún lado

description: Instalé la extensión desde https://extensions.gnome.org/ y me decía que necesitaba instalar "openss"; la ultima vez lo instalé y funcionó. Esta ocasión se me ocurrió instalar este RPM desde "Software" y funcionó sin necesidad de instalar por aparte "openss".
summary: Se debe instalar la extensión de Gnome ¿?

description:
Impossible de monter l'arborescence Android 11 sous Ubuntu 22.04 !

A must have !
seems not working, even after reboot.

working well with debian 12 on dell inspiron with samsung s10e
